Context:
Program Name: Automation Technician
Code: T950
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Part-time
Duration: 32 weeks (approximately)
Starting Months: Open enrolment (Continuous Open Enrollment for International Students)
Domestic Tuition: $1,780.00\*
Centre: Construction & Engineering Technologies
School: Mechanical Engineering Technologies
Location: Online
Program Description: The program examines applications and examples of automated manufacturing systems including both the theory and function of digital and industrial electronics, hydraulics and pneumatics, robotics systems, programming languages and alarm management. Delivered using a combination of theory and laboratory simulations using LogixSim software.
Availability: Fall 2023 (Open for Domestic Students), Continuous Open Enrolment for International Students
Related Programs: Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146), Mechanical Engineering Technology – Design (T121), Electromechanical Engineering Technology – Building Automation (T171)

Note: This program is only available to international students while remaining in their home country and does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada.

Context:
The Automation Technician program offered by the college focuses on industrial automation including digital electronics, process control, SCADA systems, programming of PLCs and robotics. Students will learn about applications and examples of automated manufacturing systems through interactive curriculum using text, 2D and 3D animations, photos, audio clips and lab simulations. The program includes 18 modules with an average completion time of 32 weeks, but there are no strict time limits.

One of the main features of this program is the integration of theory with laboratory projects using LogixSim, a suite of software products providing "real world" simulation of electricity, electronics, robotics and PLCs. Career opportunities after completing the program include roles as Automation Technicians who design, install and maintain equipment in the field of industrial automation and control.

Upon completion of the Automation Technician Certificate program, students may continue their studies and pursue a Certificate in Electromechanics, PLCs or Robotics through www.emcourse.com, www.plctechnician.com or www.onlinerobotics.com respectively. The required courses for the Automation Technician program must be taken in the following order:

Compulsory (18):
- ELNC 9116: Introduction to Automation
- ELNC 9053: [Course Name Unclear]

Context:
The text provides information about various courses offered in the Engineering Technologies - Electronics and Automation (ELNC) program at George Brown College. The following is a list of courses mentioned along with their codes:

1. ELNC 9116: Introduction to Automation
2. ELNC 9053: Industrial Control Devices
3. ELNC 9117: Motors & Control Circuits
4. ELNC 9035: Digital Electronics
5. ELCL 9060: Analog & Digital Transducers
6. ELNC 9055: Industrial Process Control
7. ELNC 9118: Distributed Control Systems
8. ELNC 9119: SCADA Systems
9. ELNC 9071: Overview of PLCs
10. ELNC 9095: Ladder Logic Programming
11. ELNC 9078: Timers
12. ELNC 9079: Counters
13. ELNC 9097: Data Handling
14. ELNC 9098: Math Instructions
15. ELNC 9101: Introduction to Robotics
16. ELNC 9108: Manipulators & End Effectors
17. ELNC 9112: Vision, Touch & Sound
18. ELNC 9113: Robot Programming

The text also mentions the tuition fees and payment options for the program:

- Domestic students pay CA$1,780 in total (Fall 2022) for tuition and materials.
- International students pay US$560, which is the equivalent of CA$714.95 at the time of registration (exchange rate not mentioned).
- Initial registration fee for all students: CA$560, which includes learning materials, laboratory simulation software, user guides, and Module 1.
- Students can pay tuition in full or opt for a pay-as-you-learn option.
- No refund on learning materials.

Additional information includes:

- The online distance program is only available to international students while remaining in their home country.
- The program does not qualify for OSAP funding.

Note that fees are subject to change for future semesters and the disclaimer states that the information may be subject to change without notice.

Context: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent is required, with a grade 11 math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U), and for mature students, a status of 19 years of age or older. The program is available to international students, but it does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada. The minimum system requirements include a Pentium-based PC or equivalent, 512MB RAM (1GB recommended), 250MB available hard disk space, Windows 7/8/8.1/10/11 operating systems, and an email account with internet access. Applications can be made by calling 416-415-4726 or visiting automationprogram.com. International students should call the given numbers or email [info@gbctechtraining.com](mailto:info@gbctechtraining.com) for more information. Related programs offered include Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146), Mechanical Engineering Technology – Design (T121), and Electromechanical Engineering Technology – Building Automation (T171). Interested individuals can also book a campus tour or sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process. The program software is strictly made for Windows Operating Systems and will not work on Apple computers, Chromebooks, or devices running Linux Operings Systems.
